Package com.github.tommyettinger.anim8

Class PNG8

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PNG8
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
    public class PNG8
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
    PNG-8 encoder with compression; can write animated and non-animated PNG images in indexed-mode. An instance can be reused to encode multiple PNGs with minimal allocation. You can configure the target palette and how this can dither colors via the palette field, which is a PaletteReducer object that defaults to null and can be reused. If you assign a PaletteReducer to palette, the methods PaletteReducer.exact(Color[]) or PaletteReducer.analyze(Pixmap) can be used to make the target palette match a specific set of colors or the colors in an existing image. You can use PaletteReducer.setDitherStrength(float) to reduce (or increase) dither strength; the dithering algorithm used here is a modified version of Jorge Jimenez' Gradient Interleaved Noise. Note that for many cases where you write a non-animated PNG, you will want to use writePrecisely(FileHandle, Pixmap, boolean) instead of write(FileHandle, Pixmap, boolean, boolean), since writePrecisely will attempt to reproduce the exact colors if there are 256 colors or less in the Pixmap, and will automatically change to calling write() if there are more than 256 colors.
    From LibGDX in the class PixmapIO, with modifications to support indexed-mode files, dithering, animation, etc. 
     Copyright (c) 2007 Matthias Mann - www.matthiasmann.de

        Sets the deflate compression level. Default is Deflater.DEFAULT_COMPRESSION.

      • write

        public void write​(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap pixmap)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the given Pixmap to the requested FileHandle, computing an 8-bit palette from the most common colors in pixmap. If there are 256 or less colors and none are transparent, this will use 256 colors in its palette exactly with no transparent entry, but if there are more than 256 colors or any are transparent, then one color will be used for "fully transparent" and 255 opaque colors will be used.
        Parameters:
        file - a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
        pixmap - a Pixmap to write to the given file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file writing fails for any reason

      • write

        public void write​(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap pixmap,
                  boolean computePalette)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the given Pixmap to the requested FileHandle, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the most common colors in pixmap. When computePalette is true, if there are 256 or less colors and none are transparent, this will use 256 colors in its palette exactly with no transparent entry, but if there are more than 256 colors or any are transparent, then one color will be used for "fully transparent" and 255 opaque colors will be used. When computePalette is false, this uses the last palette this had computed, or the 256-color DB Aurora palette if no palette had been computed yet.
        Parameters:
        file - a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
        pixmap - a Pixmap to write to the given file
        computePalette - if true, this will analyze the Pixmap and use the most common colors
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file writing fails for any reason

      • write

        public void write​(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap pixmap,
                  boolean computePalette,
                  boolean dither)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the pixmap to the stream without closing the stream, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the given Pixmap. If palette is null (the default unless it has been assigned a PaletteReducer value), this will compute a palette from the given Pixmap regardless of computePalette. Optionally dithers the result if dither is true.
        Parameters:
        file - a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
        pixmap - a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
        computePalette - if true, this will analyze the Pixmap and use the most common colors
        dither - true if this should dither colors that can't be represented exactly
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file writing fails for any reason

      • write

        public void write​(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap pixmap,
                  boolean computePalette,
                  boolean dither,
                  int threshold)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the pixmap to the stream without closing the stream, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the given Pixmap. If palette is null (the default unless it has been assigned a PaletteReducer value), this will compute a palette from the given Pixmap regardless of computePalette. Uses the given threshold while analyzing the palette if this needs to compute a palette; threshold values can be as low as 0 to try to use as many colors as possible (prefer writePrecisely(FileHandle, Pixmap, boolean, int) for that, though) and can range up to very high numbers if very few colors should be used; usually threshold is from 100 to 800. Optionally dithers the result if dither is true.
        Parameters:
        file - a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
        pixmap - a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
        computePalette - if true, this will analyze the Pixmap and use the most common colors
        dither - true if this should dither colors that can't be represented exactly
        threshold - the analysis threshold to use if computePalette is true (min 0, practical max is over 100000)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file writing fails for any reason

      • write

        public void write​(java.io.OutputStream output,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap pixmap)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the pixmap to the stream without closing the stream and computes an 8-bit palette from the Pixmap.
        Parameters:
        output - an OutputStream that will not be closed
        pixmap - a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

                  boolean computePalette)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the pixmap to the stream without closing the stream, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the given Pixmap. If palette is null (the default unless it has been assigned a PaletteReducer value), this will compute a palette from the given Pixmap regardless of computePalette.

        pixmap - a Pixmap to write to the given output stream

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        public void write​(java.io.OutputStream output,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap pixmap,
                  boolean computePalette,
                  boolean dither,
                  int threshold)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the pixmap to the stream without closing the stream, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the given Pixmap. If palette is null (the default unless it has been assigned a PaletteReducer value), this will compute a palette from the given Pixmap regardless of computePalette.
        Parameters:

        pixmap - a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
        computePalette - if true, this will analyze the Pixmap and use the most common colors
        dither - true if this should dither colors that can't be represented exactly
        threshold - the analysis threshold to use if computePalette is true (min 0, practical max is over 100000)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writePrecisely

        public void writePrecisely​(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file,
                           com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap pixmap,
                           boolean ditherFallback)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to write the given Pixmap exactly as a PNG-8 image to file; this attempt will only succeed if there are no more than 256 colors in the Pixmap (treating all partially transparent colors as fully transparent). If the attempt fails, this falls back to calling write(FileHandle, Pixmap, boolean, boolean), which can dither the image to use no more than 255 colors (plus fully transparent) based on ditherFallback and will always analyze the Pixmap to get an accurate-enough palette. All other write() methods in this class will reduce the color depth somewhat, but as long as the color count stays at 256 or less, this will keep the non-alpha components of colors exactly.
        Parameters:
        file - a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
        pixmap - a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
        ditherFallback - if the Pixmap contains too many colors, this determines whether it will dither the output
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file writing fails for any reason

      • writePrecisely

        public void writePrecisely​(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file,
                           com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap pixmap,
                           boolean ditherFallback,
                           int threshold)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to write the given Pixmap exactly as a PNG-8 image to file; this attempt will only succeed if there are no more than 256 colors in the Pixmap (treating all partially transparent colors as fully transparent). If the attempt fails, this falls back to calling write(FileHandle, Pixmap, boolean, boolean), which can dither the image to use no more than 255 colors (plus fully transparent) based on ditherFallback and will always analyze the Pixmap to get an accurate-enough palette, using the given threshold for analysis (which is typically between 1 and 1000, and most often near 200-400). All other write() methods in this class will reduce the color depth somewhat, but as long as the color count stays at 256 or less, this will keep the non-alpha components of colors exactly.
        Parameters:
        file - a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
        pixmap - a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
        ditherFallback - if the Pixmap contains too many colors, this determines whether it will dither the output
        threshold - the analysis threshold to use if there are too many colors (min 0, practical max is over 100000)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file writing fails for any reason

      • writePrecisely

        public void writePrecisely​(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file,
                           com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap pixmap,
                           int[] exactPalette,
                           boolean ditherFallback,
                           int threshold)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to write the given Pixmap exactly as a PNG-8 image to file; this attempt will only succeed if there are no more than 256 colors in the Pixmap (treating all partially transparent colors as fully transparent). If the colors in the Pixmap can be accurately represented by some or all of exactPalette (and it is non-null), then that palette will be used in full and in order. If the attempt fails, this falls back to calling write(FileHandle, Pixmap, boolean, boolean), which can dither the image to use no more than 255 colors (plus fully transparent) based on ditherFallback and will always analyze the Pixmap to get an accurate-enough palette, using the given threshold for analysis (which is typically between 1 and 1000, and most often near 200-400). All other write() methods in this class will reduce the color depth somewhat, but as long as the color count stays at 256 or less, this will keep the non-alpha components of colors exactly.
        Parameters:
        file - a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
        pixmap - a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
        exactPalette - if non-null, will try to use this palette exactly, in order and including unused colors
        ditherFallback - if the Pixmap contains too many colors, this determines whether it will dither the output
        threshold - the analysis threshold to use if there are too many colors (min 0, practical max is over 100000)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file writing fails for any reason

      • writePrecisely

        public void writePrecisely​(java.io.OutputStream output,
                           com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap pixmap,
                           boolean ditherFallback)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to write the given Pixmap exactly as a PNG-8 image to output; this attempt will only succeed if there are no more than 256 colors in the Pixmap (treating all partially transparent colors as fully transparent). If the attempt fails, this falls back to calling write(OutputStream, Pixmap, boolean, boolean), which can dither the image to use no more than 255 colors (plus fully transparent) based on ditherFallback and will always analyze the Pixmap to get an accurate-enough palette. All other write() methods in this class will reduce the color depth somewhat, but as long as the color count stays at 256 or less, this will keep the non-alpha components of colors exactly.
        Parameters:
        output - an OutputStream that will not be closed
        pixmap - a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
        ditherFallback - if the Pixmap contains too many colors, this determines whether it will dither the output
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if OutputStream things fail for any reason

      • writePrecisely

        public void writePrecisely​(java.io.OutputStream output,
                           com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap pixmap,
                           boolean ditherFallback,
                           int threshold)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to write the given Pixmap exactly as a PNG-8 image to output; this attempt will only succeed if there are no more than 256 colors in the Pixmap (treating all partially transparent colors as fully transparent). If the attempt fails, this falls back to calling write(OutputStream, Pixmap, boolean, boolean), which can dither the image to use no more than 255 colors (plus fully transparent) based on ditherFallback and will always analyze the Pixmap to get an accurate-enough palette, using the given threshold for analysis (which is typically between 1 and 1000, and most often near 200-400). All other write() methods in this class will reduce the color depth somewhat, but as long as the color count stays at 256 or less, this will keep the non-alpha components of colors exactly.
        Parameters:
        output - an OutputStream that will not be closed
        pixmap - a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
        ditherFallback - if the Pixmap contains too many colors, this determines whether it will dither the output
        threshold - the analysis threshold to use if there are too many colors (min 0, practical max is over 100000)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if OutputStream things fail for any reason

      • writePrecisely

        public void writePrecisely​(java.io.OutputStream output,
                           com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap pixmap,
                           int[] exactPalette,
                           boolean ditherFallback,
                           int threshold)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to write the given Pixmap exactly as a PNG-8 image to output; this attempt will only succeed if there are no more than 256 colors in the Pixmap (treating all partially transparent colors as fully transparent). If the colors in the Pixmap can be accurately represented by some or all of exactPalette (and it is non-null), then that palette will be used in full and in order. If the attempt fails, this falls back to calling write(OutputStream, Pixmap, boolean, boolean), which can dither the image to use no more than 255 colors (plus fully transparent) based on ditherFallback and will always analyze the Pixmap to get an accurate-enough palette, using the given threshold for analysis (which is typically between 1 and 1000, and most often near 200-400). All other write() methods in this class will reduce the color depth somewhat, but as long as the color count stays at 256 or less, this will keep the non-alpha components of colors exactly.
        Parameters:
        output - an OutputStream that will not be closed
        pixmap - a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
        exactPalette - if non-null, will try to use this palette exactly, in order and including unused colors
        ditherFallback - if the Pixmap contains too many colors, this determines whether it will dither the output
        threshold - the analysis threshold to use if there are too many colors (min 0, practical max is over 100000)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if OutputStream things fail for any reason

      • writePreciseSection

        public void writePreciseSection​(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file,
                                com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap pixmap,
                                int[] exactPalette,
                                int startX,
                                int startY,
                                int width,
                                int height)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to write the given Pixmap exactly as a PNG-8 image to file; this attempt will only succeed if there are no more than 256 colors in the Pixmap (treating all partially transparent colors as fully transparent). If the attempt fails, this will throw an IllegalArgumentException. This will keep the non-alpha components of colors exactly.
        Parameters:
        file - a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
        pixmap - a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file writing fails for any reason

      • writePreciseSection

        public void writePreciseSection​(java.io.OutputStream output,
                                com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap pixmap,
                                int[] exactPalette,
                                int startX,
                                int startY,
                                int width,
                                int height)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Attempts to write the given Pixmap exactly as a PNG-8 image to output; this attempt will only succeed if there are no more than 256 colors in the Pixmap (treating all partially transparent colors as fully transparent). If the attempt fails, this falls back to calling write(OutputStream, Pixmap, boolean, boolean), which can dither the image to use no more than 255 colors (plus fully transparent) based on ditherFallback and will always analyze the Pixmap to get an accurate-enough palette, using the given threshold for analysis (which is typically between 1 and 1000, and most often near 200-400). All other write() methods in this class will reduce the color depth somewhat, but as long as the color count stays at 256 or less, this will keep the non-alpha components of colors exactly.
        Parameters:
        output - an OutputStream that will not be closed
        pixmap - a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if OutputStream things fail for any reason

      • write

        public void write​(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap> frames,
                  int fps)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the given Pixmaps to the requested FileHandle at the requested frames per second. If palette is null (the default unless it has been assigned a PaletteReducer value), this will compute a palette from all of the frames given. Otherwise, this uses the colors already in palette. Always dithers the result.
        Parameters:
        file - a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
        frames - a Pixmap Array to write as a sequence of frames to the given output stream
        fps - how many frames per second the animation should run at
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file writing fails for any reason

      • write

        public void write​(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap> frames,
                  int fps,
                  boolean dither)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the Pixmaps to the stream without closing the stream, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the given Pixmap. If palette is null (the default unless it has been assigned a PaletteReducer value), this will compute a palette from all of the frames given. Otherwise, this uses the colors already in palette. Optionally dithers the result if dither is true.
        Parameters:
        file - a FileHandle that must be writable, and will have the given Pixmap written as a PNG-8 image
        frames - a Pixmap Array to write as a sequence of frames to the given output stream
        fps - how many frames per second the animation should run at
        dither - true if this should dither colors that can't be represented exactly
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file writing fails for any reason

      • write

        public void write​(java.io.OutputStream output,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap> frames,
                  int fps,
                  boolean dither)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the Pixmaps to the stream without closing the stream, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the given Pixmaps. If palette is null (the default unless it has been assigned a PaletteReducer value), this will compute a palette from all of the frames given. Otherwise, this uses the colors already in palette. Optionally dithers the result if dither is true.
        Parameters:
        output - an OutputStream that will not be closed
        frames - a Pixmap Array to write as a sequence of frames to the given output stream
        fps - how many frames per second the animation should run at
        dither - true if this should dither colors that can't be represented exactly
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Should probably be done explicitly; finalize() has been scheduled for removal from the JVM.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
